info.name: Realbeast API
info.description:
# Introduction
The Realbeast API allows for interaction with our systems backend - allowing inventory to be edited, new products to be added, and more. 

# Overview
Things that the developers should know about

# Authentication
You will want to use basic authentication with the following login - it should be setup in Postman if you are viewing it from there. 

- Username: `admin`
- Password: `12345`

The admin cannot be deleted. 

# Error Codes
Bad requests are the most often - for example, when you try to access an item that does not exist, it will give you an HTTP 400 / Bad Request.

item.name: Product API
Get a list of all products

response.name: Get a list of all products
Get a product

item.description:
The Product API allows products to be created, modified, added and deleted. 

There are a couple examples included for you to try out!

Almost all of these rely on accessing a product through it's ID. The ID can be found by first querying the list of all products (see examples). The product with the corresponding ID must exist for you to use it.

item.name: User API

header.value: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS

request.description: This will update the logged in User. Since this Postman documentation has the logged in admin user, any changes will be reflected in the above request: 'Get a user'.

header.value: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS
GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS

item.description:
The User API has a safe-access approach: the logged in user (all API accesses require authentication) can only modify, retrieve and delete their own user.

Users can be created at any time, however with the user POST endpoint (see examples).

Modify a specific item in a specific order

response.name: Modify a specific item in a specific order

item.name: Store API
item.description:
The Store API provides access to the different stores associated with the Realbeast Shop. 

You can create, read, modify and delete users - please see the examples for how you might do some of this.

item.name: Inventory API
Get inventory at a specifc store

response.name: Get inventory at a specifc store

item.name: Get specific product inventory for a specified store

response.name: Get specific product inventory for a specified store

item.name: Add a size for a given product at a given store
Update a product's sizing at a particular location and size
Remove a product size from a store's inventory

response.name: Remove a product size from a store's inventory

item.description: The inventory API is one of the fundamentals. This allows different stores inventory levels to be managed and updated.
